conclusion: Plan to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration phases and calculate the ratio of magnitudes during deceleration.
The graph shows particle A starting from rest, moving with constant acceleration, reaching maximum velocity, and decelerating back to rest. Particle B moves with constant acceleration.

Identify acceleration phases: Particle A accelerates from 0 to v0 over time t0, then decelerates back to 0 over time 3t0. Particle B accelerates from 0 to v0 over time t0 and continues with constant acceleration.
Calculate acceleration for Particle A during acceleration: a1 = v0/t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle A during deceleration: a2 = -v0/3t0.
Calculate constant acceleration for Particle B: aB = v0/t0.
Find ratio of acceleration magnitudes during deceleration: a2/aB = -1/3.
Absolute value of the ratio is 1/3.
